DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Withdrawal by Subject Lost To Follow-up Notification Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate investigator notification of the study participant's lost to follow-up status.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Withdrawal by Subject Lost To Follow-up Notification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A researcher in a study who oversees multiple aspects of the study, such as concept development, protocol writing, protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation._An indication that a study participant has removed itself from the study._The loss or lack of continuation of subject participation after a study has officially closed._Informing by words.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: a researcher in a clinical trial or clinical study.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Property.preferredName: Withdrawal by Subject Lost To Follow-up Notification
Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a study participant has removed itself from the study.:The loss or lack of continuation of subject participation after a study has officially closed.:Informing by words.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a study participant has removed themself from the study or from one or more segments of the study.
The loss or lack of continuation of subject participation after a study has officially closed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt transferred context, semantic change to Obj to match DEC long name, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. Created for Round 5 Lost to Follow Up NCI Template CRF

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
